data.text: The app makes it easier to use Affirm at checkout and makes it very easy to make payments on the loans I have with them. The detail section of your purchases and agreements are easily understood with their visual breakdown they give you on the manage page. I'm not one to jump on loans either so this is not a quick sent review. I applied to see if I would have any ability to use them and once I did, I didn't even purchase anything for a few months and then started with something real small.

Best savings app ever!!!! I've been using this free app for over a year. I like that I can schedule automatic deposits into it for however much I want. Their interest APY is insanely good so I'm now receiving more than $10/month just in interest on my own money. As my balance gets larger, so does the interest I'm making. I just set 2 automatic deposits per month and forget about it. Its a wonderful way to build up an emergency fund without feeling stretched with your normal paycheck!

I've been using this for maybe 8 months. No problems with my payments (except for a late payment due to affirms error) They'd even recently raised my limit. Then I paid off two loans early and suddenly I'm not approved to use the service anymore for any amount. I really don't understand and since I use for emergency purchases it's really inconvenient. No one seems to be able to help me figure it out.
data.replyText: Because we consider each transaction separately, the amount that you can borrow from Affirm will be dependent on the information that we have at the given time. Just because your loan wasn’t approved for this particular purchase doesn’t mean you can never obtain financing with Affirm. - CJ, Customer Care

data.text: I absolutely love the app. I love affirm, period. How cool is it that you can select your loan payments and they will let you switch the due date. It's pretty awesome when you can split the payments instead of paying for it all at once. This is pretty awesome. I even received the affirm credit card. It's absolutely one of my most fav one of credit cards. Usually it's interesting free. I do love this app. I set up auto pay and I never have the be bothered with payments or late payment. Awesome

Been making payments ahead of time, for some reason affirm returns funds back to my bank, i have to make payment again and by that time it says late payment. I called customer service several times and they aren't helpful at all, they have no answer as to why its happening and won't fix it and all this goes to my credit report. Overall every purchase goes smooth. But unfortunately just gonna pay what I owe and close account.
data.replyText: We'll look into this issue for you. Please send us a note at customercare@affirm.com so that we can follow up. - CJ, Customer Care

data.text: This is ok if you need help. However they DO NOT report to the credit agencies so it won't help your credit at all. Update: I have 3 loans (2 paid off and One payment left on the 3rd). Not once have they reported to ANY of the credit reporting agencies. NOT ONCE. They don't do it in spite of their claims otherwise. The lie the developers give was the reason it lost a star from the 3 I originally gave it.
data.replyText: Hi there. Affirm currently reports some loans and repayment activity to Experian and may report to other credit bureaus in the future. Typically, your first monthly installment loan with Affirm is reported. After you’ve had at least one loan furnished, Affirm won’t report subsequent loans unless they become 30+ days overdue. -JS, Customer Care

data.text: I was a little skeptical about Affirm and the ACTUAL cost of financing with them; that was 4 years ago. I am delighted to say that they have been absolutely exceptional in every way. Their fees are very reasonable, financing options more than adequate, and just all around near perfect. I have recommended them to many people, to the point I have been asked on more than one occasion if I work for them or are an affiliate for them. Thank you, keep up the GREAT WORK!

Faulty Auto Pay. I have used the app for about 3 years and have always used auto pay. Sometimes the app does not withdraw payments from my bank even though there are funds available to cover the payment. The app then shows that the payment is late. (Edit): I looked further into the issue and noticed someone else's bank account was linked to my active loan. The account numbers are not similar at all. This seems to be a clerical error made by an Affirm employee.

They didn't charge any late fees at all. Otherwise I always pay my loan through direct deposit. My purchase power went up fast and they approved a new loan everytime when I applied for one.

I loved using it. Then out of nowhere Affirm took away all my credit. I had late payments post due to the app not taking out the automatic payments I set up. I can't understand why. Now I'm having to re verify and its not working. I loved using affirm for vacations but now summers gonna suck because it won't let me revrify even though I've completed all the steps necessary. data.text: Great App, easy to navigate. Affirm clearly shows you what your spending power is, hundreds v stores to shop at. if the place you want is not available, you have the option v requesting a certain amount and adding the "payee". Affirm makes it easy for you to change your due date if you're unable to pay on scheduled date and you can make extra payments or pay it off early. The more reliable you are, the higher your spending power!

Phenomenal, excellent buy now pay later app. The approvals are very fast, the interest rates are very reasonable. The best part is that you get to choose the amount of payment that suits you best, and also by choosing auto pay your payments are always on time so zero worries. They even notify you in advance of incoming payment to be made so you make sure you have your bank account already up to date. EXCELLENT APP!!! I wish I had it sooner.

Good for holiday store sales, Amazon Day, or when Affirm has zero interest loans on tons of the most popular retailers. Loans are based on credit but sometimes it's off.. about 1/3 rd of the time. Credit score goes up... loan availability amount decreases? check the app later - its $2100 instead of the intial $4500. Since they work with a bank it would be cool if they reported your many payoffs to the credit bureaus since credit is used as a basis for your eligibility. Interest rate is good.

I don't like how easy it is to make a payment with saved things. It doesn't ask you to confirm. With touch screens you can accidently hit a button while you are paying before you select a payment method. At the very least not have the payment method already int here. Then there needs to be some way to cancel the payment. If credit one is able to cancel payments affirm should be able to do that. Especially right after you make it. I've had at least twice I bumped it while going to pay.

data.text: "At the time of review" This loan program will get you out of a bind. Some of my purchases didn't have interest. Straight forward service with options for automatic payments, updates via text or email, and the app is frequently updated. Down sides are all on you the customer, keep track of your finances and don't over extend. This Affirm app is truly a privilege to use so don't mess around and lose access.

If done responsibly, this app can be of great use in times of need or in ways of paying something in payments. I love the no late fees, though 99.9% I'm on time, and the fact there are no pre-payment penalties. So if I can pay down a loan faster I save on interest. I used to be able to do no interest but that seemed to change, the only thing I do miss. It is easy to use and I love the card that is attached to the account for offline purchases. If you are careful it can be a useful tool

Best app I have purchased from, considering they make it easy to browse. The only thing I want is be able to pull a receipt but I haven't figured that out yet. Also as of today 3/16 I finished. But note if you're credit score goes lower than they require don't expect anything else even if you have making payments on time. The customer service advised me of this!

I just started using it recently and it's been excellent 👍 Found out about stores I never knew existed. That's how far they reach. Still getting better and better. I can't complain. Just discovered that one can't change the autopay dates on accounts. This is causing very serious financial stress on me since I am on a fixed income. I might have to be late on some payments.

data.text: I have had zero issues with Affirm. I was hesitant at first, when I discovered Affirm about a year ago, but I tried it and very glad I did. I made sure to set up auto pay so I didn't miss a payment. I forget what my initial credit line was, but is its only a few hundred dollars. Now my,credit line with them is over 5,000. Affirm saved my butt a few times when in an emergency, and I was able to use a virtual card for some big purchases in store. They also make sure you get your refunds promptly.

There really needs to be a better way to explore shopping options. When you click something to see what it's about, you're suddenly almost applying for a loan to that store and you'll get a phone call to either "complete your application", or a call that there's possible fraud on your account; even if you hit the back button to get out of the would be application you didn't mean to go into. Maybe add some steps to confirm an application, because this feels predatory.

data.text: I've used Affirm for dozens of purchases both in store and online. The affirm debit+ card is great for in-store planned purchases and the app is awesome for online transactions. Low monthly payments, low fixed fee, no compound interest, no late fees, no prepayment penalties and it's pretty much accepted everywhere! Initial spending limit was sufficient enough to put away my credit cards only minor issue is that it hasn't gone up? Credit score of 780 and no late payments should have increased it!

Hiccup, once. Growing pains (mine). What is and should be important is the convenience and ease of shopping with Affirm. The opportunity you are given to build or repair your credit and the VERY fair interest charges. Multiple purchases over 2 years. Extremely Happy. Trying to reduce credit card debt at the moment. I will be back in 6 months.

I've had a really good experience with Affirm. I haven't been turned away from any qualifying purchases. With on time payments, I've gotten frequent increases in purchasing power. They're pretty easy to use & have multiple payment options. They also report to the 3 agencies, which helps your overall credit score. I have no regrets.

There are great options for paying for bigger purchases over time with little to no interest. Love using this platform. Started using their savings account, which is a high interest savings plan. I can add funds directly from my paycheck it's really helped me establish a safety net in case of unexpected expenses. Highly recommend giving them a try.

data.text: I have been using affirm for almost 5 years now. I set up auto payment linked to my bank. I have never had an issue. The interest rates are amazing, especially to credit credit cards apr, I love to use other people's money rather then my own. It keeps my money I do have for emergencies or other things that come up in life in my possession. Sometimes I even get 0% on a year, I pay it off early with no penalties. What I'm basically saying is if you're on the fence just do it. I have no regrets!

I like Affirm. I think I have been with them two years, never late on my payments. I like being able to buy now pay later (layaway), because I'm on a fixed income. It's a great company to be apart of. Now, I had a credit limit of $1000 with them, aways paid on time. I noticed at times they reduce limit without notice or reason. I feel like anyone who have kept their arrangements should never receive a lower limit.

So far Ive enjoyed my experience with Affirm. Im thankful for the services they provide for SURE! Getting ahold of customer services can be difficult sometimes, though. Ive been using them for probably about 2.5 yrs now and really havent had any issues. They're also typically great with processing return immediately. Ive had issues with other servers in the past (Klarna) for not processing my return or funds for weeks past due, I make it a point NOT to use them anymore (Klarna).

UPDATE:The debit card from Affirm is ok but you can only do a couple of purchases before they cut you off for about 3 days. Talking about under $50 ones that don't need to be on a payment plan. Hard to use the Affirm debit it place of my bank one when you get locked out after spending one. Also bank relink not working. Affirm is great for times you need some help with the way money and getting groceries or unexpected repairs hit and you are already paying for other life changing events that hit.

It is nice to have an option to pay over time if you didn't expect to make a purchase any given moment. Affirm has been very helpful in this way. Use of there phone app makes it very convenient to see your offered lending availability, details of a purchase, when payments are due etc.... You can shop within the app or online at any merchants site and take a look if merchant provides Affirm as an option. Only negative would be high interest rate but it seems every bank/lender has high rates.

I've had Affirm for years, at least back to April of '21. I've never missed a payment, and always been accepted. I know that technically there really isn't a difference between it and a credit card; but for me it's been wonderful. I usually pay off early, anyway. It's great. I've neve had any problems, and have suggested it to many people. They've all loved it. I feel like this comes off as an advert for them, but it really isn't, I just have had a great relationship with Affirm! Thanks!

This app is great stay on time with your payments and plan ahead and your golden. It's better then using a credit card and if you do get a interest rate it's reasonable. I got 2 on my first 2 purchases and after that I didn't get them anymore, so if your looking for a better way to pay this is a good option.

Greetings, if am individual has fair to good credit and they would like to purchase items with 0 money down or little money down this application is awesome. As well when you are a great payee they will send a card and it's metal. God Bless hopes this helps for whomever is wondering how it could assist in your daily life. As well it reports to credit all 3 breaus which helps with versatility with credit accounts. It shows as loan and they 3xtwmd more credit once you complete the loan contracts.

It's been helpful. But when you miss one payment by two week one bill payment , I felt like I got the third degree and was threatened that it was going to be turned over to a collection agency. And I had just paid off one of my accounts with affirm. And then my available balance was dropped. I do like the way the account balances are set up. Otherwise I like using affirm for my financial needs.

Shop Pay/Affirm is great, until you need to contact them. They hint that they have an email address in there somewhere but good luck finding it. Some of the options look like they will link to help, but they don't. The app runs you around & usually dumps you back where you started. It's terrible. I'm not rating the service when everything goes right. That's great. Their website & app are also OK for most things. But the run around you get when you need help has to be deliberate, IMO. Not OK.

data.text: This is a really awesome app,I use Affirm for things like concert tickets,l get tickets for a show, and don't worry about spending the extra money. I usually have them paid off by the time the show date arrives. You get to set your payment options short-term higher payment or spread them out smaller payment. I have had an outstanding experience using Affirm! The simplicity of splitting my purchases into manageable payments made budgeting a breeze. The process was transparent, and I appreciated how clear they were about terms and fees. Affirm's flexibility in payment options and their user-friendly interface made it a top-notch choice for managing my expenses. Overall, a fantastic service that I highly recommend to anyone looking for a more convenient way to make purchases.

At first they give you so much purchasing power. Don't let it trick you, I've paid off six purchases pretty much on time but just because I've had hard times and had to pay a bit later (they don't have late fees) they now won't help with anything at all. I have a steady income now but I'm a student who doesn't have any real credit. Most of my purchases and payments haven't even reflected on my credit either. That's pretty much my biggest complaint. My payments should be reflected!

data.text: Out of all the credit card accounts that I have this one is the best. I can pick how months I want to make payments depending on the offers. In the last 2 years I have charged hundreds and paid each one off in 6 months cause I get to pick 6 or 12 months to pay them off. Whichever I can afford to pay. This is my favorite account to charge on. Have a great time using it.

I wish I had found this app sooner. Very easy to navigate, shop, & check for your approval amount. Sometimes Affirm will have discounts, on top of the individual stores sales, which is great for a bargain Betty. The fees to buy now, pay later are small in comparison to a credit or department store card. There are options on how you want to pay the loan back. All at once or over a six month period (I can't remember if you can go past six months). I'll be using this app for quite some time.

Gave a one star. Changing to a three. Although, your CS team is lacking knowledge of the product and processes. Contacted them regarding a refund and they couldn't seem to understand what I was asking or resolve the issue. Long story short, app is fine but CS team needs to brush up on policies and procedures, as well as the product. App has buttons in inconvenient places. Example: support chat icon is in the same area as zoom in help page. Couldn't click it at all because zoom.
data.replyText: Hi, we are sorry that you faced an issue. Could you please share your contact details with us on customercare@affirm.com so that we can get in touch with you and resolve the issue. -TL, Customer Care

data.text: Quite good for payment plans, especially the more expensive stuff. However, it's a 2 star rating because trying to link your bank account with the debit card they provide is a nightmare. Their linking service, Plaid, does not support a lot of local credit unions (including mine); that and Credit Karma and PayPal are also on their "no support" list. So if you primarily use those, there's a good chance your card will mostly be useless. Waste of resources and time if you ask me.
data.replyText: We appreciate you sharing your experience. Customer input is invaluable to us, and your feedback means a lot to us. - TL, Customer Support

data.text: I use this app sparingly because you can quickly accumulate excessive debt if you don't. The app is easy to use and may offer two choices with or without interest. I particularly like that they give you an idea of your "spending power" so you what you can and can't buy with it. I also like that you can see details of how much the borrowing would cost you in total. The app itself has a good UI and easy to use. Some may so too easy. But as long as you spend wisely you won't have a problem.

So far I've had no hassle's, no issues with Affirm. If used correctly, this is a great way for people to establish credit. also a great way for people to purchase big purchases they can't afford in one big sum. They late you make extra payments, which comes off the next month's bills which helps when you may be short on a check that month! Love this app. Love this idea! Thank you Affirm

When you don't use the full amount, or use it at all, it takes way too long for that amount to show back up on your account, if ever. Edit 10/24/23: They seem to maybe have fixed some of the issue behind the scenes, I was able to actually cancel the unused amount that I didn't use, due to them paying for something that wasn't approved. Now if they could just get the hang of dark mode and make cancellation refunds more timely.

data.text: Easy to use, a great option vs using a credit card. I have used Affirm several times and have been extremely happy with the rates, and the no penalty for early payoff. Recommend highly! Update 7/2823 Still happy with Affirm. It is a great option to use it rather than a credit card. Update 12/20/23 Still excellent company, easy to use, perfect alternative to running up credit card balances. Purchases are paid off easily.

I've really enjoyed using Affirm and how quick and easy it is to process a transaction with no money down. I always have auto-pay setup, which really 6 my payments on time. Also, a good relationship with Affirm. The only reason I can't give them a 5☆ at the moment is because of the lack of options to use in store, like Home Depot. They don't offer any sort of updated payment methods, and without a physical card, all transactions must remain online.

Great place to shop! Right in the comfort of your home or even at the store... can't pay? They'll pay for you and you can pay later! Easy to use... even has reminders for payment, auto pay, or just get a text to remind you, text back a code, and they'll take out the payment for you... no long wait times to call customer service. Everything is right at your fingertips and all along your building credit!!!

A headache eraser when you need to make last min purchases. This has saved me getting my vehicle fixed last min and I can see/ PICK the payments, there never is prepayment penalties and I've used and shared with others to use it OFTEN! Instead of getting a credit card charged up and then it's full, just use Affirm digital card and make your purchase in store! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! The auto payments are the 2nd best part!

Pretty good when you're in a pinch! I see the new virtual card feature coming in handy if I'm ever in an emergency situation too. Just keep in mind your credit score will determine if you're eligible and your maximum loan amount. If your score goes down, your maximum may also go down. Overall, a nifty service when used right. Just don't make a habit of using it too often

This app is great for consumers who are on a tight budget. It allows patrons to afford purchases through low-cost installments. One negative about using this app is that there is no room to adjust the customer payment schedule. Sometimes emergencies arise where someone will need to delay a payment, and this company and its app don't seem to understand or care about that. The second negative side to using this app is that all purchases made are not interest-free. Conversely, Klarna does both.

data.text: I love using Affirm much more than credit cards. Its super easy to use, they set up up easy payments and you get it paid off in a short time. You get to choose your length of payments so you can handle getting it paid for. And, when I downloaded the app and signed in, i learned alot more about the ease of using Affirm. Its just a great way to buy things and get them paid off. Would definitely reccomend to everyone.

I absolutely love this Affirm App. There are times when you don't want to use certain credit cards, and the Affirm App is right there for you. I needed to purchase items and was unable to, and Affirm made it happen for me. The more you use it, the better your limits are. Awesome way to purchase the items you need at affordable monthly payments. Get your digital card today!!!

Love it! It's great having the option to make installment payments and well as also choosing the length i.e. 3, 6 months, etc... I even got the Affirm card to pay on store which is another plus not to mention all the discounts and perks each time you use Affirm and make on time payments. All in all, I've been using the app for over a year now and would/have recommended it to friends and family.

It's nice to have the option to split purchases up into payments without using credit, but it's incredibly frustrating to be at the mercy of their decision making process when it seems totally random whether you're approved or not. I've paid off around $2,000 over several loans, in full, and they suddenly decided I'm not worth loaning to anymore. You can't count on them and that's not the kind of fairweather service I want.

data.text: I like to put bigger purchases kinda to not ding my account right away for some reason and pay it off usually early and not during the long payment term time period. You pay off early, you avoid alot of the interest fees. I grabbed on to some expensive items using affirm and they helped me get what I wanted and payed it off at a later date, it's that simple and easy.

Had some ups and downs with identity verification for a while, but over all I have financed a tremendous amount through them and paid it off. If you pay on time and don't miss payments your eligible amount goes up. Update: identity issues were fixed, and I have to say if you need to pay over time affirm is way to go, they have the best payment options and multiple other benefits including a savings account, I have made many many purchases through them and it was all worth it, love affirm

Excellent! App, GUI ease of use, great layout, people friendly for sure. This actually deserves 5 full stars, but when it comes to chat with a live agent or sending a message, it can be quite cumbersome where visibility of your texts is hard to see, not in mobile mode friendly, and when navigating online stores to buy, the back button on your device when pressed will remove you from your browsing experience. These two things are minor in comparison to the overall features and functions.

At first, Affirm was a great purchase option. Then, after years and paying off about 15+ separate loans on time, they won't give me any more credit. Plus, every time you log on the app, they hit your credit report. I actually had crappier credit in the past, and they still gave me a spending limit. Update 11/13/23: I was gonna give more stars because they gave me some credit after this post, but now that it is paid off again... they are denying any further purchase power. Not consistent!!

data.text: Best payment app. I have used them for a couple of years now. Had an issue with them at the beginning but it was resolved. Now I use them often. Easy to pay and manage each purchase. It does them separate instead of putting it all in one like a credit card. I'm not sure what their credit limit is but I hope they continue to increase mine. I like using it better than my credit card.

The app is very difficult to use and has been for sometime. Open a store to shop and you try clicking on options and nothing opens! Try refreshing the page and still nothing. Cant book a hotel because you click on "view deal" and again, nothing. Just keep clicking and nothing. And every store has these issues. So the its 100% the affirm app and is very frustrating. Will not be using for a long time because simply, no point

data.text: All good till you need help. Hard to find a contact. App takes you all around. Very slow response time for refunds. data.text: My first review 4.26.22 was a negative one, and I originally left a 1-star rating because my initial experience was so frustrating. Well, almost 2 years now, and 4 purchases totaling almost $2500. I'm by no means a veteran, but making a purchase, scheduling a payment, making those scheduled payments is a snap! My perspective and my experience have changed; affirm has helped me to establish credit while purchasing the items that I need. However, reaching a rep can be difficult if needed? Nov 2023
